item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Joseph B Wirthlin
item.description: "The most treasured and sacred moments of our lives are those filled with the spirit of love. The greater the measure of our love, the greater is our joy. In the end, the development of such love is the true measure of success in life." -- Joseph B Wirthlin

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Booker T. Washington
item.description: "The longer I live and the more experience I have of the world, the more I am convinced that, after all, the one thing that is most worth living for-and dying for, if need be-is the opportunity of making someone else more happy." -- Booker T. Washington

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Anonymous
item.description:
"For I am convinced that neither death nor life neither angels nor demons neither the present nor the future nor any powers neither height nor depth nor anything else in all creation will be able to separate us from the love of God that is in Christ Jesus our Lord.
Romans 8:38" -- Anonymous

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Spencer W. Kimball
item.description: "The more we serve our fellowmen in appropriate ways, the more substance there is to our souls. We become more significant individuals as we serve others. We become more substantive as we serve others—indeed, it is easier to “find” ourselves because there is so much more of us to find!" -- Spencer W. Kimball

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by George MacDonald
item.description: "It is by loving and not by being loved that one can come nearest to the soul of another." -- George MacDonald

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Leo Buscaglia
item.description: "Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around." -- Leo Buscaglia

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Abraham Joshua Heschel
item.description: "Our goal should be to live life in radical amazement. ....get up in the morning and look at the world in a way that takes nothing for granted. Everything is phenomenal; everything is incredible; never treat life casually. To be spiritual is to be amazed." -- Abraham Joshua Heschel

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Aesop
item.description: "No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted." -- Aesop

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "It is not my ability, but my response to God’s ability, that counts." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by David O. McKay
item.description: "Every noble impulse, every unselfish expression of love, every surrender of self to something higher than self, every loyalty to an ideal, every fine courage of the soul – by doing good for good’s sake – that is spirituality. – " -- David O. McKay

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Booker T. Washington
item.description: "I will permit no man to narrow and degrade my soul by making me hate him." -- Booker T. Washington

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Joseph Smith Jr.
item.description: "A man is saved no faster than he gains knowledge" -- Joseph Smith Jr.

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Try a little harder to be a little better." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Work at our responsibility as parents as if everything in life counted on it." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Cultivate an attitude of happiness. Cultivate a spirit of optimism. Walk with faith, rejoicing in the beauties of nature, in the goodness of those you love, in the testimony which you carry in your heart concerning things divine." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Jenkin Lloyd Jones
item.description: "Anyone who imagines that bliss is normal is going to waste a lot of time running around shouting that he has been robbed. The fact is that most putts don’t drop, most beef is tough, most children grow up to be just like people, most successful marriages require a high degree of mutual toleration, and most jobs are more often dull than otherwise. Life is just like an old time rail journey ... delays, sidetracks, smoke, dust, cinders, and jolts, interspersed only occasionally by beautiful vistas and thrilling bursts of speed. The trick is to thank the Lord for letting you have the ride." -- Jenkin Lloyd Jones

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "True love is not so much a matter of romance as it is a matter of anxious concern for the well-being of one's companion." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "I don't want to drive up to the pearly gates in a shiny sports car, wearing beautifully, tailored clothes, my hair expertly coiffed, and with long, perfectly manicured fingernails. I want to drive up in a station wagon that has mud on the wheels from taking kids to scout camp. I want to be there with a smudge of peanut butter on my shirt from making sandwiches for a sick neighbors children. I want to be there with a little dirt under my fingernails from helping to weed someone's garden. I want to be there with children's sticky kisses on my cheeks and the tears of a friend on my shoulder. I want the Lord to know I was really here and that I really lived." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "Be kind. Everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle." -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marjorie Pay Hinckley
item.description: "How did a nice girl like me get into a mess like this?" -- Marjorie Pay Hinckley

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by M. Russell Ballard
item.description: "All the marvels of nature are glimpses of His divine power and expressions of His love." -- M. Russell Ballard

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Emmuska Orczy
item.description: "She, too, had worn a mask in assuming a contempt for him, whilst, as a matter of fact, she completely misunderstood him" -- Emmuska Orczy

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "I can do all things through Christ who strengthens me." -- Anonymous

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marvin J. Ashton
item.description: "The best and most clear indicator that we are progressing spiritually and coming unto Christ is the way we treat other people." -- Marvin J. Ashton

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marvin J. Ashton
item.description: "Perhaps the greatest charity comes when we are kind to each other, when we don’t judge or categorize someone else, when we simply give each other the benefit of the doubt or remain quiet. Charity is accepting someone’s differences, weaknesses, and shortcomings; having patience with someone who has let us down; or resisting the impulse to become offended when someone doesn’t handle something the way we might have hoped. Charity is refusing to take advantage of another’s weakness and being willing to forgive someone who has hurt us. Charity is expecting the best of each other" -- Marvin J. Ashton

item.title: Rachelle add a quote by Marvin J. Ashton
item.description: "If we could look into each other’s hearts and understand the unique challenges each of us faces, I think we would treat each other much more gently, with more love, patience, tolerance, and care." -- Marvin J. Ashton
